Topic.Title: Wow.........wow........wow. Those ugly pensions showing their heads again.

Message.Msg: how did GM do with that philosophy. Unions SUCK!
32.5, 32.45, that's dumb, too close together

It is just an interest rate used in present value models to determine what funds investors need now to generate larger amount in the future. It is just working backward from the future amounts. This is also a non-cash/onetime charge. It is not really a near term issue for the company. The actuarial loss is due to an estimation of funds that may or may not be needed in future years for pensioners( could be 10 or 20 years out). Companies normally show unrealized losses and gains to pension funds when the markets are up or down. They started reporting them on an annual basis a few years back instead of deferring them for many years. This was designed to smooth out the impact to balance sheets and provide some transparency to investors but it may be more confusing to them anything. It is best to look at it from a long term point of view. The actuary assumption is for future years. Today it may show that a companies needs funds for pension obligations in future years (lets say 15 years out) and 3 years later it may say that the company has more than enough funds. This charge was also not a surprise to the markets. Most investors already knew it was coming months ago. VZ announced its planned charges to earnings a month ago, it did not impact stock price much. This is a non-issue...
Hold on a second... An informative post on one of these boards? I don't believe it.

Sprint is a totally different type of phone, personally I would never use Sprint because I travel all over the world so I buy local SIM cards to cut costs. I'm not the only one either. All company's have to deal with these types of problems so these 'issues' should be no surprise. The debt you speak of is not an issue at all. People need to stop worrying about headline news and just relax and enjoy the years and years of divy payments. I have this stock in my 401k and its been very good to me since I bought it in the lows 20s.

Medicare and SS were both proven 'wrong' when the government failed to manage either appropriately and continues to mismanage along with both hundreds of other Federal programs that fail to provide the benefits promised or the within the costs calculated. There is a lot to be said for families taking care of families instead of the Federal government claiming the right to do so.

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ...“Nothing in the world is more dangerous than a sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.” – Martin Luther King, Jr. “I can stand brute force, but brute reason is quite unbearable. There is something unfair about its use. It is hitting below the intellect.” – Oscar Wilde “Ten days from now Barack Obama will be inaugurated. I'm telling you, it is really starting to look bad for Mitt Romney." - David Letterman “Between the great things we cannot do and the small things we will not do, the danger is that we shall do nothing.” – Adolph Monod “Falsehood is invariably the child of fear in one form or another.” – Aleister Crowley "The 2013 Oscar nominations were announced today. 'Lincoln' earned the most nominations of any movie. 12 nominations for 'Lincoln.' I have a feeling that if he were alive today, Lincoln would say, 'What is a movie’?” – Jimmy Fallon “Democracy is the art of thinking independently together” – Alexander Meiklejohn “You don't get harmony when everybody sings the same note.” – Doug Floyd "It's reported that if you're playing Angry Birds, the company is tracking your location. This may seem silly to you, but it's actually how we got bin Laden." - Conan O'Brien “Just because nobody complains doesn't mean all parachutes are perfect.” – Benny Hill “One who condones evils is just as guilty as the one who perpetrates it.” – Martin Luther King “At the heart of racism is the religious assertion that God made a creative mistake when He brought some people into being” – Friedrich Otto Hertz "The beginning of the movie 'Lincoln' has been slightly changed to explain the Civil War to foreign audiences. Or as Lincoln put it, 'I would have preferred a different ENDING’.” - Jimmy Fallon “The next time you go out to a smoking party, young feller, fill your pipe with that 'ere reflection.” – Charles Dickens “In water one sees one's own face; But in wine one beholds the heart of another” – French Proverb “President Obama’s half-brother is running for political office in Kenya. Donald Trump has already accused him of being born in the United States." – Conan O’Brien “Time rushes towards us with its hospital tray of infinitely varied narcotics, even while it is preparing us for its inevitably fatal operation.” – Tennessee Williams “I have a fine sense of the ridiculous, but no sense of humour.” – Edward Albee "President Obama is coming under criticism that his new administration has less diversity than his first one. Which is why this morning Obama said, 'All right, fine, I am a Muslim." - Conan O'Brien “A nation or civilization that continues to produce soft-minded men purchases its own spiritual death on an installment plan.” – Martin Luther King, Jr.

Message.Title: AHQ (cont.)...
Message.Msg: ... “Music is the movement of sound to reach the soul for the education of its virtue.” – Plato “It is horrifying that we have to fight our own government to save the environment.” – Ansel Adams "Abraham Lincoln, our 16th president, has never been hotter. 'Lincoln' received 12 Oscar nominations. 'Lincoln' also received a nomination for best hat." – David Letterman “Never forget that everything Hitler did in Germany was legal.” – Martin Luther King, Jr. “A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.” – Mark Twain "U.S. customs officials recently discovered 310 pounds of marijuana hidden in some frozen carrots. "Carrots and marijuana – how good will your vision be after THIS combination?" - Jay Leno “The human race's prospects of survival were considerably better when we were defenceless against tigers than they are today when we have become defenceless against ourselves.” – Arnold J. Toynbee “Believe me! The secret of reaping the greatest fruitfulness and the greatest enjoyment from life is to live dangerously!” – Friedrich Nietzsche "This year nobody was elected to baseball's hall of fame. No player has ever gotten into the hall of fame without winning Ohio." – David Letterman “The quality, not the longevity, of one's life is what is important.” – Martin Luther King, Jr.
